doc.field: Constance Reid Collection of Richard Courant Oral History Interviews
Constance Reid Collection of Richard Courant Oral History Interviews

Constance Reid (1918-2010) was a writer who specialized in biographies of mathematicians. The Constance Reid Collection of Richard Courant Oral History Interviews consists of oral history transcripts and some additional ephemera donated by Constance Reid to the Courant Institute Library.

Constance Reid (1918-2010) was a writer who specialized in biographies of mathematicians. The Constance Reid Collection of Richard Courant Oral History Interviews consists of oral history transcripts and some additional ephemera donated by Constance Reid to the Courant Institute Library.
The Constance Reid Collection of Richard Courant Oral History Interviews consists of oral history transcripts and some additional ephemera donated by Constance Reid to the Courant Institute Library.
Constance Reid (1918-2010) was a writer who specialized in biographies of mathematicians.

This collection was treated as an administrative transfer to the New York University Archives from the Courant Institute in the summer of 2023 when the Courant Institute Library closed. The accession number associated with this transfer is 2024.001.
Constane Reid donated this collection to the Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences Library in December 2004.
